intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium selvaerense, commonly known as the Selvaer sandweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
